requiredMaterials.title: Thermodynamics, an Engineering Approach
requiredMaterials.authors: Y. Cengel, M. Boles, M. Kanoglu

topics: Enthalpy and internal energy of real gases
Power cycles: Otto, Diesel, Stirling, Brayton, Rankine

readingAssignments.approach: Suggested reading material given in schedule
readingAssignments.strategy: Skim text preceding lecture; read slowly and carefully after homework identifies needed understanding

quizzes.format: Unannounced, may occur at any time
quizzes.makeups: No make-up quizzes unless special circumstances (see instructor)

homework.submission: Two separate digital documents per assignment

types.approach: Attempt problems first on your own; if stuck, encouraged to ask friends, TA, instructor, or use AI tools like ChatGPT
types.allowedResources: Comparing with AI solutions or solution manual encouraged before submission
types.restriction: Should not copy others' work but may use to assess your work

types.purpose: Test yourself and ability to solve problems independently
types.restriction: May not use AI tools or solution manual
types.collaboration: May ask TA, instructor, or classmate for help
types.validation: Grading rubric asks you to validate independence of work

homework.grading: Solutions posted within 10 minutes of due date; student grades own work and posts score within 24 hours
homework.latePolicy: Late homework generally not accepted; one exception granted per student

labs.teamwork: May work in teams of 2 or individually to design experiment and collect data
labs.reportWriting: Each individual writes separate lab report
labs.example: Swamp Cooler Lab with full report

exams.schedule: Three exams throughout semester plus final
exams.format: In-class exams; final at university-designated date and time
exams.attendance: Must be present in person for final

examGrading.process: Instructor wants to correct grading errors
examGrading.regrade: Submit mis-graded exams with written explanation
examGrading.noMinorReevaluations: Do not submit for re-grade of 1-2 point corrections
examGrading.clarification: Talk to instructor or TA if you don't understand exam problem

coursePolicy.modifications: Instructor reserves right to make changes in schedule, policy, procedures, and grading with advanced notice
